documents.name: VIII - 5. one offs_amounts for adjusted ebitda.xlsx
V1 - 1.Supplier List for the Last Three Years - VAT included.xlsx

findings.content: VIO Transgrup S.R.L. is a Romanian road freight transportation company founded in 2000, headquartered in Targoviste with 207 employees and EUR 34 million turnover in 2024.

The company operates a fleet of 287 vehicles (99 trucks, 168 trailers) serving European routes with specialized services including temperature-controlled, pharmaceutical, ADR/dangerous goods, and high-value cargo transport.

Revenue declined from EUR 38.2M (2022) to EUR 34.0M (2024), with EBITDA falling 78% from EUR 2.48M to EUR 0.55M. Adjusted EBITDA for 2024 is EUR 1.64M (4.8% margin) after adding back EUR 1.1M of holding-related costs.
Acquired by International Alexander Holding in late 2020. The holding company is controlled by the Simion Ioan Apreutese family with 2023 revenue of approximately EUR 134.6 million.

Investment considerations: (1) Strong certification portfolio including TAPA TSR Level 1, ISO standards, GDP, and TISAX; (2) Diversified service offerings; (3) Experienced European operator; (4) Significant customer concentration (top customer 21.4% of revenue); (5) 2026 budget shows turnaround potential with 8.3% EBITDA margin target.

2026 Budget indicates significant turnaround: EBITDA targeted at EUR 2.73M (8.3% margin) vs EUR 0.55M actual in 2024 (1.6% margin). Net profit projected at EUR 1.14M. Budget properly accounts for EUR 1.8M depreciation.
Founded in 2000 by Viorel Angelescu and Adriana Angelescu as a trucking company.
Original location: Ungureni (Dragomiresti), Dambovita county, Romania. Current headquarters: Targoviste, Romania.
Acquired by International Alexander Holding in late 2020.
Founder Viorel Angelescu passed away in June 2021.
Post-integration address: Zona Industriala Sud Nr. 6, Arad.
Legal entity name: VIO TRANSGRUP S.R.L. Company registration number (CUI): 13476201.
2000: Company founded in Ungureni, Dambovita county, Romania.
2010: First HVC (High Value Cargo) transport performed for DHL.
2014: Became first company in Romania to achieve TAPA TSR Level 1 certification.
2016-2017: Obtained TAPA membership.
Late 2020: Acquired by International Alexander Holding.

executives.name: International Alexander Holding Management
executives.title: Integrated Management Structure
executives.background: Current management structure integrated with International Alexander Holding post-acquisition. The holding company is controlled by the Simion Ioan Apreutese family.

findings.content: Core business: Road freight transportation services across Europe, with primary routes Romania to/from Western Europe (Germany, France, Italy, Spain, etc.).
General Goods Transport: Standard FTL (Full Truck Load) and LTL (Less Than Truckload) services.
Automotive Transport: 25 years experience serving OEM and Tier 1-3 automotive suppliers.
Temperature-Controlled Transport: Range from -25C to +30C with frigo trailers (160 units).
Pharmaceutical Transport: GDP (Good Distribution Practice) compliant for pharmaceutical logistics.
ADR/Dangerous Goods Transport: Certified for hazardous material Classes 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9.
High Value Cargo (HVC): TAPA TSR Level 1 certified - first certified company in Romania since 2014. First HVC transport performed in 2010 for DHL.
Groupage/LTL Services: Consolidation and less-than-truckload options for smaller shipments.
Total fleet: 287 vehicles - 99 trucks (Euro 6), 168 trailers (including 160 frigo trailers, 5 Krone mega trailers), 19 light vehicles, 1 bus.
Average fleet age: 5.8 years. Fleet ownership: 80% owned (229 units), 20% on leasing/credit (58 units).
Top fleet manufacturers: SCHMITZ trailers (127 units, 44%), SCANIA trucks (44 units), KRONE (27 units), MAN (27 units), VOLVO (15 units).
TAPA TSR Level 1 (Transported Asset Protection Association) - First certified company in Romania (2014).
ISO certifications: ISO 9001:2015 (Quality), ISO 14001:2015 (Environmental), ISO 45001:2018 (Health & Safety), ISO 27001:2022 (Information Security).
GDP (Good Distribution Practice) certification for pharmaceutical logistics compliance.
TISAX (Trusted Information Security Assessment Exchange) certification for automotive industry standards.
ADR certification for dangerous goods transport (Classes 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9).
Global transportation market value added: USD 4.06 trillion (2023).
European road freight market is mature with consolidation among larger players.

Key industry trends: sustainability focus, electrification of fleets, intermodal transport growth, digitalization driving efficiency through telematics, route optimization, and fleet management systems.
Romanian trucking market benefits from lower labor costs vs Western Europe.
Primary customer segments: Automotive OEMs and suppliers, pharmaceutical/healthcare, high-value goods manufacturers, temperature-sensitive goods producers.
Total customer count 2024: 1,424 customers with EUR 34.0M total revenue.
Revenue by business unit available: General Transport, HVC, Temperature-controlled, etc.
Personnel cost per employee 2024: approximately EUR 27,600/year (EUR 6,076,693 / 220 employees).
Revenue 2022: EUR 38,171,959
Revenue 2023: EUR 37,377,595
Revenue 2024: EUR 34,001,978
Revenue 2025 Forecast: EUR 34,737,456
Revenue CAGR 2022-2024: -5.6% (decline from EUR 38.2M to EUR 34.0M)
Revenue 2026 Budget: EUR 33,000,000 (slight decline from 2025E but with significant margin improvement focus)
EBITDA 2022: EUR 2,477,858 (6.5% margin)
EBITDA 2023: EUR 1,746,299 (4.7% margin)
EBITDA 2024: EUR 545,604 (1.6% margin)
EBITDA 2025 Forecast: EUR 974,458 (2.8% margin)
EBITDA decline 2022-2024: -78% (from EUR 2.48M to EUR 0.55M)
Net Profit 2022: EUR 2,022,538
Net Profit 2023: EUR 1,289,847
Net Profit 2024: EUR 356,802
Net Profit 2025 Forecast: EUR 1,153,792
Total EBITDA adjustments for standalone operations: EUR 1,097,368. Adjusted EBITDA 2024: EUR 1,642,972 (4.8% margin).

source.document: VIII - 5. one offs_amounts for adjusted ebitda.xlsx

findings.content: EBITDA adjustments breakdown: Publicity costs EUR 141,390, Rent and utilities EUR 121,251, Holding-related costs EUR 803,695, Other EUR 31,032.

source.document: VIII - 5. one offs_amounts for adjusted ebitda.xlsx

findings.content: Personnel expenses 2024: EUR 6,076,693. Other operating expenses 2024: EUR 27,379,681.
Depreciation 2022-2025: EUR 0 (DATA QUALITY ISSUE - no depreciation recorded despite EUR 5.2M PP&E).
Interest expense 2024: EUR 188,802
EBITDA 2026 Budget: EUR 2,725,000 (8.3% margin) - represents 5x improvement from 2024 actual of EUR 545,604 (1.6% margin)
Gross Profit 2026 Budget: EUR 11,000,000 (33.3% margin). COGS budgeted at EUR 22,000,000 (66.7% of revenue).

source.location: Sheet: VTG 2026, Rows: Cost of goods sold, Gross Trading Profit

findings.content: Depreciation 2026 Budget: EUR 1,800,000 (5.5% of revenue) - NOTE: First year with depreciation recorded, resolving prior data quality issue.
EBIT 2026 Budget: EUR 925,000 (2.8% margin)
Net Profit 2026 Budget: EUR 1,137,282 (3.4% margin) - 3x improvement from 2024 actual of EUR 356,802
Personnel expenses 2026 Budget: EUR 4,050,000 (12.3% of revenue). Other operating expenses: EUR 4,225,000 (12.8% of revenue).

source.location: Sheet: VTG 2026, Rows: Salaries and wages, Other expenses

findings.content: Interest expense 2026 Budget: EUR 195,000 (0.6% of revenue). Other operating income: EUR 325,000. Other financial income/expenses: EUR 205,000.
Tax expense 2026 Budget: EUR 122,718 (9.7% effective tax rate on EBT of EUR 1,260,000)
Revenue CAGR 2022-2024: -5.6%
Debt-to-Equity ratio 2024: 2.7x
Net Debt 2024: EUR 9,627,104 (Bank Debt EUR 10,816,093 minus Cash EUR 1,188,989).

source.location: Calculated from Akt. and Pas. sheets

findings.content: Total Assets 2024: EUR 18,003,553
Property, Plant & Equipment (PP&E) 2024: EUR 5,189,741
Financial Assets 2024: EUR 5,131,831
Trade Receivables 2024: EUR 6,032,893
Cash and Cash Equivalents 2024: EUR 1,188,989
Total Liabilities 2024: EUR 16,179,782 (NOTE: Balance sheet does not balance - EUR 1,823,771 discrepancy vs assets).
Bank Debt 2024: EUR 10,816,093
Trade Payables 2024: EUR 798,393
Banking relationship: UniCredit Bank
First TAPA TSR Level 1 certified company in Romania (2014) - strong positioning for high-value cargo transport.
Comprehensive certification portfolio: ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001, GDP, TISAX, ADR - enabling access to regulated industry segments.
25 years experience in automotive transport serving OEMs and Tier 1-3 suppliers.
Diversified service portfolio: general goods, temperature-controlled (-25C to +30C), pharmaceutical, ADR/dangerous goods, HVC, and groupage.
Romanian cost advantage: Lower labor costs compared to Western European competitors.
Land transportation accounts for 85.2% of transportation CO2 emissions - industry faces sustainability pressure.
2026 Budget demonstrates margin expansion strategy: EBITDA margin targeted at 8.3% (EUR 2.73M) vs 1.6% actual in 2024, representing 5x improvement through cost optimization.
Cost structure optimization: COGS targeted at 66.7% of revenue (EUR 22M) yielding 33.3% gross margin. Operating expenses (salaries + other) at 25.1% of revenue.
Revenue stabilization focus: 2026 budget targets EUR 33M revenue (vs EUR 34.7M 2025E), prioritizing profitability over top-line growth.
CRITICAL: EBITDA declined 78% from EUR 2.48M (2022) to EUR 0.55M (2024). Significant margin compression.
Revenue decline of 11% from 2022 to 2024 (EUR 38.2M to EUR 34.0M).
High customer concentration: Largest customer represents 21.4% of 2024 revenue (EUR 7,268,117). Top 5 customers: 45.7%, Top 10: 56.4%, Top 20: 68.3%.
Increasing customer concentration trend: Top 5 share growing year-over-year.
High supplier concentration: Top 3 suppliers represent 43.2% of spend (EUR 23.8M total). Top 5: 50.2%, Top 10: 61.8%. Largest categories: transport subcontractors and fuel.

source.document: V1 - 1.Supplier List for the Last Three Years - VAT included.xlsx

findings.content: Significant debt load: Bank debt of EUR 10.8M against EUR 4.1M equity (2.7x Debt-to-Equity). Net Debt: EUR 9.6M.
Management transition risk: Founder Viorel Angelescu deceased June 2021, company now integrated into holding structure.
Carve-out complexity: Holding-related costs of EUR 803,695 need standalone replacement (management fees, shared services).

source.document: VIII - 5. one offs_amounts for adjusted ebitda.xlsx

findings.content: Fleet financing: 58 vehicles (20% of fleet) on leasing/credit create ongoing obligations.
Industry headwinds: Pressure from fuel costs, driver shortages, and sustainability requirements.
Average employees 2022: 220, Year-end: 269
Average employees 2023: 225, Year-end: 234
Average employees 2024: 220, Year-end: 228
Employees December 2025: 207
Personnel cost per employee 2024: approximately EUR 27,600/year
Geographic coverage: Romania and European countries (Germany, France, Italy, Spain, etc.). Primary routes: Romania to/from Western Europe.
International Alexander Holding is controlled by the Simion Ioan Apreutese family.
International Alexander Holding 2023 revenue: approximately EUR 134.6 million.
M&A advisor for current sale process: Deloitte Romania.

all_findings.content: Legal entity name: VIO TRANSGRUP S.R.L. Company registration number (CUI): 13476201.
Founded in 2000 by Viorel Angelescu and Adriana Angelescu as a trucking company in Ungureni, Dambovita county.
Total fleet size: 287 vehicles (99 trucks, 168 trailers, 19 light vehicles, 1 bus). Average fleet age: 5.8 years.
Revenue 2024: EUR 34,001,978. EBITDA 2024: EUR 545,604 (1.6% margin). Adjusted EBITDA 2024: EUR 1,642,972 (4.8% margin).
Total EBITDA adjustments for standalone operations: EUR 1,097,368 (Publicity EUR 141,390, Rent/utilities EUR 121,251, Holding costs EUR 803,695, Other EUR 31,032).

source.document: VIII - 5. one offs_amounts for adjusted ebitda.xlsx

all_findings.content: Top customer 2024: EUR 7,268,117 (21.4% of revenue). Top 5 concentration: 45.7%. Total customers: 1,424.
Bank Debt 2024: EUR 10,816,093. Cash: EUR 1,188,989. Equity: EUR 4,073,970. Debt-to-Equity: 2.7x.
Certifications: TAPA TSR Level 1 (first in Romania 2014), ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001, GDP, TISAX, ADR Classes 2,3,4,5,6,8,9.
Employees December 2025: 207. Average employees 2024: 220. Personnel cost per employee: EUR 27,600/year.
Services: General goods, automotive transport (25 years), temperature-controlled (-25C to +30C), pharmaceutical (GDP), ADR/dangerous goods, HVC (TAPA certified), groupage/LTL.

2026 Budget: Revenue EUR 33M, Gross Profit EUR 11M (33.3%), EBITDA EUR 2.73M (8.3% margin), Depreciation EUR 1.8M, EBIT EUR 925K, Net Profit EUR 1.14M. Significant turnaround from 2024 with 5x EBITDA improvement.

incomplete_data.missing: Depreciation not recorded in 2022-2025 financials despite EUR 5.2M PP&E - EBITDA may be overstated. NOTE: 2026 Budget includes EUR 1.8M depreciation.
Balance sheet does not balance in 2024 (Assets EUR 18.0M vs Liabilities EUR 16.2M = EUR 1.8M discrepancy)
Cost of materials/COGS not separately broken out in P&L - cannot calculate gross margin
Customer names anonymized in revenue list - cannot identify specific customers for due diligence
Management team details not provided beyond ownership structure - cannot assess experience or retention risk
Fleet insurance and maintenance costs not separately disclosed
No customer contracts or terms provided - cannot assess contract length, termination rights, pricing
IT systems and digitalization level not documented
Working capital seasonality and cash conversion cycle not analyzed
Supplier data includes VAT - amounts may need adjustment for like-for-like comparison

recommendations: Request clarification on depreciation treatment and balance sheet reconciliation
Obtain management team bios and organizational structure
Request customer contract samples and key customer identification
Obtain working capital analysis and cash flow statements
Request IT systems documentation and fleet maintenance records
Clarify supplier costs net of VAT for accurate cost analysis
